intro: Hieracium vulgatum subsp. pseudosenile, commonly known as the common hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble daisies. The plant typically grows to a height of 20–60 cm, with basal leaves that are broadly lanceolate and covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are yellow, with ray florets that are usually shorter than the disc florets. It thrives in disturbed soils and is often found in meadows, roadsides, and waste areas.
